Posts.Content: morrisrachel wrote:   Hi.  I had posted before, but am now looking for more information.  My mother in law had breast cancer.  She had a lumpsectomy back in November.  They found cancer in her lymph nodes and diagnosed her with Stage III cancer.  They only found cancer in one lymph nodes though.  After doing further test, they said they got it all and that there was nothing to worry about.  She had to have a port put in for the chemo/radiation.  She started chemo in January.  She has been very sick from this.  The doctors are giving her more medications to help. She has lost 30 pounds so far!  Which really scares me, because that is a lot.  Is that normal?  The doctors are just not talking to us much.  Just changing medicines and doing what they have to do.  Anyway.  My question is, does chemo/radiation bring out other things in your body.  For example, since she has started chemo she has gotten a cyst on her leg.  The doctor said they would just watch this and make sure it did not get bigger.  Then they found one on her kidney.  Last week a spot came up on her forehead.  So, does anyone know if chemo/radiation does this to you, or is there something else I should try looking into?  The doctors just say they are going to keep an eye on them.  They really will not explain any thing to us, so we are a little unsure of what is going on.  I have known people who have gone through chemo before, but none of this has ever happened.  I am just wondering if the cancer is not already at these other places in her body and now the chemo is bringing it so we can see it.  Is that silly??  If anyone has any information about this, it will be greatly appreciated!!  Thanks.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Chemo/Radiation Question? morrisrachel Cathy-CA
